label: 卯槌
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: A short, thin, round or square peachwood stick, about three to five inches long, with a perforation at the paper-wrapped top, from which colored streamers and othe decorations suspended.  Given to the Emperor and others, either officially or privately, on the first Day of the Hare; also served as magical protectors and springtime decorations in the Daytime Chamber and the houses of the nobility.
